definition: thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: The prince is forced to kill Ursula by stabbing her with a ship.
sentences.chinese: 王子被迫用船頭刺死了厄斯拉。

sentences.english: Official statistics indicate 13 civilians were burned or stabbed to death.
sentences.chinese: 據官方統計，13名平民被燒死或刺死。

sentences.english: Man stabs one to death, injures 4 .
sentences.chinese: 常州禮嘉一打工者刺死一人，刺傷4人。

sentences.english: Marat was stabbed to death, and I'm worked to death.
sentences.chinese: 馬拉是被人刺死，而我是過勞死的。

sentences.english: It just happens not to accord with our modern understanding of what would have happened to a woman struck accidentally by a spear.
sentences.chinese: 它和我們的關於這個女子被長矛意外刺死的理解相左。

sentences.english: When he was 16, his best friend was stabbed to death.
sentences.chinese: 當他16歲時，他最好的朋友被人用刀刺死。

sentences.english: They stuck a bison with spears.
sentences.chinese: 他們用長矛刺死了一頭野牛。

sentences.english: Her nephew is accused of helping her to stab him to death and cut up his body
sentences.chinese: 她的侄子被指控幫助她刺死丈夫，並切碎他的屍體。

sentences.english: And they could have daily mock stabbings and fake blood.
sentences.chinese: 然後這些吉祥物每天都可以模擬被鮮血淋漓地刺死。

sentences.english: Caesar is stabbed by the senators; Christ is cuffed by lackeys .
sentences.chinese: 愷撤被元老院議員刺死，耶穌捱了奴僕的巴掌。

definition: to hack to death/to kill with an ax
to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
to hit with a piercing blow
to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
to attack with a bladed weapon
